objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The authoring organization of the threat report, as indicated in the YARA rule metadata and the report disclaimer.

objects.name: 1st Stage Download Host
objects.description: Domain hosting the signed first stage downloader.

objects.name: 2nd Stage Download Host
objects.description: Domain from which the first stage downloads the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK Download URL
objects.description: Full URL used by the first stage to download the DAMASCENED PEACOCK payload.

objects.name: C2 Domain
objects.description: Command and control domain used by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to retrieve the third stage.

objects.name: 3rd Stage Payload Path
objects.description: File path where DAMASCENED PEACOCK writes the downloaded third stage payload.

objects.name: COM Hijack Registry Key
objects.description: Registry key modified by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to achieve persistence and execution for its downloaded payload via COM hijacking.

objects.name: Indicator for 1st Stage Downloader (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the first stage downloader, Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe, which is signed and delivered via spear-phishing.

objects.name: Indicator for 1st Stage Downloader (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the first stage downloader, Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe, which is signed and delivered via spear-phishing.

objects.name: Indicator for 1st Stage Downloader (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the first stage downloader, Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe, which is signed and delivered via spear-phishing.

objects.name: Indicator for DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK second stage DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK second stage DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK second stage DLL.

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: A lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows, delivered via spear-phishing. It is the second of three stages and is responsible for downloading the final stage and executing it via a COM Hijack. It implements defence evasion techniques such as XOR-based string obfuscation and dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs.

objects.name: rustyclaw
objects.description: A malware variant documented by Talos, part of the wider RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is considered a variant of RustyClaw.

objects.name: snipbot
objects.description: A malware variant documented by Palo Alto, part of the wider RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is considered a variant of SnipBot.

objects.name: romcom
objects.description: A wider malware family that includes DAMASCENED PEACOCK, RustyClaw, and SnipBot.

objects.name: dustyhammock
objects.description: A malware mentioned in the report as the final stage payload that DAMASCENED PEACOCK downloads and executes.

objects.name: UK Ministry of Defence
objects.description: The organization targeted by the spear-phishing campaign that delivered the DAMASCENED PEACOCK malware.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: A cybersecurity organization that previously documented RustyClaw, a malware variant related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Palo Alto
objects.description: A cybersecurity organization that previously documented SnipBot, a malware variant related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: The entity listed as the subject in the code signing certificate used to sign the first-stage malware.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the 3rd stage it downloads by COM Hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with Dynamic Resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is signed, meaning DAMASCENED PEACOCK executes within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
